ygData.subject: RE: Missed Notes
ygData.msgSnippet: Carillion is hard to start until you get your wind skill up.  I used to get 75% failures till I maxed wind, then got about 5-10% until about 2 weeks ago when
ygData.messageBody:
Carillion is hard to start until you get your wind skill up. I used to get
75% failures till I maxed wind, then got about 5-10% until about 2 weeks ago
when it increased to 25%. I tried it 50 times with wind at 13, suceeded 14
times. Tried 50 times with 75 skill, suceeded 46 times, tried last nite 50
times at 83 skill, suceeded 41 times. Also my dex and wisdom are both 5
points higher than they were at 75 skill and my char is still at 121. And
to think I originally did this just to see how much effect music skill
really had on missed notes.

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: Snicker Furfoot, Esq. [mailto:snicker@...]
Sent: Wednesday, August 11, 1999 2:56 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Missed Notes


From: "Snicker Furfoot, Esq." <snicker@...>

At 04:47 PM 8/11/99 -0400, Jyzan wrote:
>
>Actually, you said "maybe a total of 30 times". Not exactly precise
numbers.
>So you're saying that it's a 100 percent failure rate on a sample size of
>30? I
>certainly understand why you'd be upset. Thing is, that's awfully hard to
>believe when I haven't had a failure rate of higher than 10 percent on any
song
>I've tested with recently. Nobody else is claiming 100 percent failure
rates
>either.
>

I didn't include my Carrilon details, because I assumed that certain songs
are just a pain in general. But I do have at least a 50% failure rate on
it, even at 15th. Anyone else notice the Charisma song being tough to
start? The Lullaby (which I just got) starts normally, even if it is
resisted 50% of the time *chuckles*

Talies the Wanderer
